From pop through to folk and roots, a  classic voice for classic music. title: George Boomsma
date: Sunday 20 April 20257:30 pmHaving been honing his songwriting craft and live performances over the past decade, George has been gaining some well earned attention and acclaim. title: Teenage Waitress
date: Friday 25 April 20257:30 pmTo fill his quota of anxiety-based meltdowns for the year, Teenage Waitress has written a one-man show and is bringing it back to us at TFR. It contains songs, stories, reflections on songwriting and visuals. title: Astrid Williamson
date: Monday 28 April 20257:30 pmAstrid Williamson returns to promote her tenth studio album, Shetland Suite, a collection of traditional songs and instrumentals reimagined for the 21st century. Shetland Suite comprises of an evocative fusion of folk, electronics and field recordings and is due for release on Incarnation Records in September 2024.Astrid Williamson returns to promote her tenth studio album, Shetland Suite, a collection of traditional songs and instrumentals reimagined for the 21st century. title: Jimmy Herrity
date: Tuesday 6 May 20257:30 pmJimmy Herrity & band perform his debut album 'The Weatherman live in full for the first time, ahead of release at the end of 2025. title: The Deep Dark Woods
date: Monday 12 May 20257:30 pmThe voice of founding member Ryan Boldt sits at the forefront of the band, and it doesn't take long to reveal that he is a master of subtlety and shading, working in the lineage of iconic singers like Bob Dylan, Bert Jansch, Rick Danko, and Jason Molina.The voice of founding member Ryan Boldt sits at the forefront of the band, and it doesn't take long to reveal that he is a master of subtlety and shading, working in the lineage of iconic singers like Bob Dylan, Bert Jansch, Rick Danko, and Jason Molina.

title: The Attendant
date: Wednesday 21 May 20257:30 pmPete Astor, leader of seminal Creation Records’ guitar combos The Loft and The Weather Prophets, brings you The Attendant, mixing electronics and live instruments, spoken word, and pop choruses. title: Shotgun Jimmie
date: Thursday 29 May 20258:00 pmShotgun Jimmie is a singer-songwriter/one-person-band based in Manitoba, Canada. He’s been touring regularly and releasing records on Toronto’s You’ve Changed Records since 2009. Jimmie cut his rock & roll teeth in the early 2000’s, as part of the seminal Canadian indie outfit Shotgun and Jaybird.Shotgun Jimmie is a singer-songwriter/one-person-band based in Manitoba, Canada. He’s been touring regularly and releasing records on Toronto’s You’ve Changed Records since 2009. title: Lucy Mellenfield
date: Sunday 8 June 20257:30 pm2025 sees the release of Lucy Mellenfield’s highly anticipated debut album, Tell The Water, She Will Listen. She embarks on her pre-release tour this summer. The songs explore her love of jazz, folk, and alternative genres, interweaving improvisation and folk melodies, immersive soundscapes and vivid lyric writing.2025 sees the release of Lucy Mellenfield’s highly anticipated debut album, Tell The Water, She Will Listen. She embarks on her pre-release tour this summer. The songs explore her love of jazz, folk, and alternative genres, interweaving improvisation and folk melodies, immersive soundscapes and vivid lyric writing.

title: Folklore Monthly Showcase
date: Tuesday 17 June 20257:30 pmHaving run since 2014, the Folklore showcase is a staple of the Brighton music scene having featured thousands of artists.Three of our favourite artists for a FREE ENTRY showcase on the 3rd Tuesday every month.- Arrive early to gain entry.Having run since 2014, the Folklore showcase is a staple of the Brighton music scene having featured thousands of artists.Three of our favourite artists for a FREE ENTRY showcase on the 3rd Tuesday every month.- Arrive early to gain entry.

title: Tugboat Captain
date: Friday 27 June 20257:30 pmOne of the most unique propositions in London’s music scene, Tugboat Captain bring their brand of  Baroque Indie-Pop to TFR for a Friday night to remember.One of the most unique propositions in London’s music scene, Tugboat Captain bring their brand of  Baroque Indie-Pop to TFR for a Friday night to remember.

title: Will Stratton
date: Tuesday 8 July 20257:30 pmHis eighth album, Points of Origin, comes out March 7th on Ruination Records (USA) and Bella Union (worldwide).  His previous albums received critical acclaim from Sir Elton John and Alexis Petridis (The Guardian), as well as journalists at Pitchfork, Mojo, and Uncut, among others.His eighth album, Points of Origin, comes out March 7th on Ruination Records (USA) and Bella Union (worldwide). title: Albertine Sarges
date: Monday 3 November 20257:30 pmThe universality of pop music can mean different things to different people. For Berlin native musician and producer Albertine Sarges it’s a vessel for self-exploration and growth. Displaying an insatiable mix of avant-garde pop, weird folk and magical flute.
